kea package¶

kea.constants module¶

kea.hist module¶

class kea.hist.BPASS_hist¶

Bases: kea.hist.histogram

Container for the BPASS data to reside and make it possible to perform basic operations on the enclosed data.

This class inherits all function of histogram, but overrides a few to allow for easier manipulation of linear and logarithmic data.

The internal binning is linear in Gyr, but plotting can be done in linear and logarithmic binning.

Fill(x, w=1, ty=None)¶

Adds data to the BPASS histogram

Parameters

  • x (float/array) – Either a single entry or an array of N to put into the histogram

  • w (float/array) – The weight of the entry of N entries to be added to the histogram.

  • ty (string) – The type of input data. Either “log” or “lin”. If none is given, log is assumed

copy()¶

Create a copy of the BPASS histogram

Returns

A copy of the BPASS historam.

Return type

BPASS_hist

getLinBins()¶

Returns the middle points of all bins, except the first bin, which runs from 0 to \(10^{6.05}\), but returns \(10^6\).

Returns

The middle points of all bins in linear space

Return type

array

getLinEdges()¶

Returns the edges in linear space

Returns

The bin edges in linear space

Return type

array

getLogBins()¶

Returns the middle points of all bins, except the first bin, which runs from 0 to \(10^{6.05}\), but returns 6.

Returns

The middle points of all bins in logarithmic space

Return type

array

getLogEdges()¶

Returns the edges in logarithmic space, except for the first bin, where the lowest edge is set to 5.95 instead of 0 for plotting purposes.

Returns

The bin edges in logarithmic space

Return type

array

integral(x1, x2)¶
Returns the integral of the histogram between x1 and x2.

It return an integral in units \(\#events/yr/M_\odot\)

Parameters

  • x1 (float) – lower bound of the integration

  • x2 (float) – upper bound of the integration

Returns

The integral between x1 and x2

Return type

float

plotLin(*argv, **kwargs)¶

Plot the histogram on a linear axis.

plotLog(*argv, **kwargs)¶

Plot the histogram on a logirthmic axis

class kea.hist.histogram(xlow=None, xup=None, nr_bins=None, edges=None)¶

Bases: object

A histogram which can contains data and can be manipulated. Either xlow, xup, and nr_bins is given or edges

As per any histogram, the upper edges are non inclusive, except for the last bin.

Parameters

  • xlow (float) – lower bound

  • xup (float) – upper bound

  • nr_bins (int) – the number of bins

  • edges (array) – An array with items defining the edges.

_xlow¶

lower bound of the histogram

Type

float

_xup¶

upper bound of the histogram

Type

float

_nr_bins¶

the number of bins in the histogram

Type

int

_bin_edges¶

An array of bin edges

Type

array

_values¶

An array of length _nr_bins containing the value of each bin

Type

array

lower_edges¶

An array of the lower edges of the bins in the histogram

Type

upper_edges¶

An array of the upper edges of the bins in the histogram

Type

kea.load module¶

kea.load.gunzip(source_filepath, dest_filepath, block_size=65536)¶

Unpacks a zipped file.

Parameters

  • source_filepath (string) – The path to the file to unpack

  • dest_filepath (string) – The filename to unpack to

  • block_size (int) – The size of data to keep in memory at once

kea.load.loadAllRates(data_folder)¶
Loads the SNe & compact merger rates for all

available metallicities in BPASS

Parameters

data_folder (string) – Folder containing the BPASS & GW models

Returns

A dictionary in a dictionary containing BPASS histograms. All BPASS metalicities are used and all BPASS & GW event types or used.

The event rate are in #events/yr/\(M_\odot\).

Return type

dict[“metallicity”][“event type”]

kea.load.loadBPASS(file, types)¶

load BPASS rates.

Parameters

  • file (string) – A string pointing to a file to be loaded

  • types (array of strings) – An array of types of events to load from the BPASS file

Returns

A dictionary with BPASS histograms of the supernovae event rates from the file with an entry of each give type in types. The event rates are in #events/yr/\(M_\odot\).

Return type

dict of BPASS histograms

kea.load.loadGW(file, types)¶

Load the given types from the Graviational wave events file

Parameters

  • file (string) – The path to a gravitational wave file from BPASS

  • types (array of strings) – the type of events to extract from the file

Returns

A dictionary with BPASS histograms of the gravitational wave event rates from the file with an entry of each give type in types. The event rates are in #events/yr/\(M_\odot\).

Return type

dict of BPASS histograms

kea.load.packnload(file)¶

Load the data from a BPASS zipped file.

Parameters

file (string) – A string pointing to a zipped version of BPASS data.

Returns

A pandas DataFrame containing the model data from the BPASS file, which is a hoki output.

Return type

pandas DataFrame

kea.mergerHistory module¶

kea.mergerHistory.buildHistory(cosmological_model)¶

Build the merger tree histories of galaxies existing today.

Parameters

cosmological_model (pandas DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame containing the following information: - galaxyID - stellarMass - bulgeMass - sfr - hotGas - coldGas - descendantId

Returns

An array of nodes with galaxies present in the now. These nodes contain the merger history of the galaxy in its children.

Return type

array

kea.mergerHistory.findNode(nodeID, node)¶

Find a node in a tree.

Parameters

  • nodeID (int) – The node to find in the tree

  • node (node) – A node with possible children attached.

Returns

A node associated with the given nodeID

Return type

node

kea.mergerHistory.getSFR(galaxy)¶

Extract the stellar formation rate given a root node of a merger tree.

Parameters

galaxy (node) – A node of a galaxy

Returns

A numpy array of the stellar formation rate over time.

Return type

numpy array

kea.mergerHistory.getType(node)¶

calculate the galaxy type according to … paper with the bulge-to-total mass ratio.

Parameters

node (node) –

a node containing the required data:

  • coldGas

  • stellarMass

  • bulgeMass

  • hotGas

Returns

An integer identifingthe type of galaxy.

kea.mergerHistory.pprint_tree(node, file=None, _prefix='', _last=True)¶

Print the node and its children; basically the tree.

Parameters

  • node (node) – The starting node from where to print

  • file (string) – output to a file

  • _prefix (string) – A prefix for printing

  • _last (Boolean) – Check if this is the last node

kea.rates module¶

kea.rates.getEventRates(SFR, DTDs, sampling_rate, now)¶

Calculates the events rates by combining BPASS models and the cosmological simulations.

Parameters

  • SFR (scipy.interpolate spline function) – A scipy.interpolate spline of the stellar formation rates (in \(M/yr/Mpc^3\))

  • DTDs (dictionary of BPASS_hists) – The Delay Time Distributions extracted in BPASS ordered in a histogram based on the event type

  • sampling_rate (int) – The sampling rate for the new histogram (number of bins)

  • now (float) – The current age of the universe in Gyrs.

Returns

A dictionary containing histograms with the event rates per event type with units \(\#events/yr/Gpc^3\).

Return type

dictionary of histograms

kea.rates.getSFRD(cosmological_simulation, time_relations, length, h)¶

Extracts the total star formation rate density from a cosmological model without taking the metallicity into account.

Parameters

  • cosmological_simulation (pandas DataFrame) – The cosmological simulation where to extract the SFR from. Needs to contain a column with ‘sfr’.

  • time_relations (pandas DataFrame) – contains the relation between snapshot number (snapnum) and lookback time

  • length (float) – the length of the simulation

  • h (float) – the Hubble parameter

Returns

An array with a length of 64 with the stellar formation rate.

Return type

numpy array
